p.s: The Tragedytragedy The Great Gatsby, was written by F. Scott Fitzgerald and published in 1925.
The book deals with the impossibility of recapturing the past and the difficulty of altering one's future.
In the given extract Gatsby leaves Nick's house as soon as Daisy enters but returns right after at the front door.
Daisy still thinks she just meets Nick for tea.
As Gatsby enters the living room where Daisy sits to encounter her, both of them are overwhelmed by their meeting.
At first they have a quiet closed conversation overshadowed by embarrasmentembarrassment on both sides.
Furthermore Nick wants to leave his house through the front door and Gatsby follows him to talk.
Gatsby explains Nick that their meeting is a mistake, but Nick tells Gatsby to pull himself together and go back to Daisy.
After Gatsby reenters the living room, him and Daisy have a simple conversation again, characterized by deep eye contact and pure embarassmentembarrassment.
Finally Gatsby invites Daisy and Nick over to his mansion.
